newsitem.title: USA: Lockheed, Computer Sciences win order.
newsitem.headline: Lockheed, Computer Sciences win order.

text.p: The Patent and Trademark Office Wednesday awarded Lockheed Martin Corp and Computer Sciences Corp orders worth $254 million and $287 million respectively over eight years to expedite and improve evaluation of patent and trademark applications.

A statement from the Department of Commerce quoted Assistant Commerce Secretary and Commissioner of Patents and Trademarks Bruce A. Lehman as saying: "A healthy patent and trademark system will enable the nation to build for the future and promote U.S. competitiveness ... by strengthening and safeguarding the nation's economic infrastructure."
The statement said the PTO received over 236,000 patent and 200,000 trademark applications in fiscal 1996, and expects to get 30 to 50 percent more per year by 2000.
